719231f-a.text:
Cornelia Street and Sixth Avenue convergence, southwest from West 4th Street. The Avenue is to the left. Note the "El" pillars at West 3rd Street where this structure turns eastward. The curb line of W. 4th Street is at the
lower right.
About 1900

730220f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 4th Street - 6th Avenue (Northeast).]
730220f-a.text:
A general view, northeast from 4th Street and Sixth Ave., showing the spire of the Hetropolitan Life Insurance Building, (Madiaon Ave.,
at 23rd St.,) in the distance.
April 3, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

730221f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 4th Street - 6th Avenue (Southeast).]
730221f-a.text:
A general view, southeast from 4th Street and Sixth Ave.
April 3, 1928,
P. L. Sperr.

710908f-a.text:
150-140 West 4th Street, (rear and side views), adjoining and east of the S.E. corner of Sixth Ave. Also shown are Nos. 147-135 West 4thStreet, north side, between Sixth Ave., and Washington Square West. The Wasuington Square M.E. Church is at Nos. 135-139. Building No. 150 (bearing theatrical
eigns) is a frame structure in 2 parte.
April 3, 1928.

710903f-a.text:
Washington Scuare Methodist Church, 135 West 444th Street, north side, between Sixth Avenue and Macdougal Street. This chdrch antedates

710905f-b.text:
(1)
146-148-150 West 4th Street, adjoining the clearing on the S.E. corner of Sixth Avenue. The little white house with the real estate office is an old frame structure. The shed to the right was put up after the east side of Sixth Avenue
was cleared.
March 11, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, looking towards Sixth Avenue, aad showing no part of
146 except the electric sign "Pepper Pot".
Between 148 and 150 is the entrance to a one-story frame, originally a cow barn, behind 150 West 4th Street. In the 1920's this was occupied by 'The Samovar" tea room; their sign over the entrance is still faintly legible. Since the time of the first view the premises have evidently been
occupied by a Chinese Hand Laundry.
May 24, 1933.
L. Sperr.
